entry.title: HOT WEATHER CONTINUES, SEASONAL NORMS START WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: August 25, 2025 4:10 a.m. While the Heat Advisory expired Sunday night, two more days of hot weather is expected in the Umpqua Valley before conditions return to seasonal norms starting Wednesday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 100 degrees at...

entry.title: COOLING CENTER REMAINS OPEN THROUGH TUESDAY, SUPPLIES NEEDED

entry.summary: August 25, 2025 3:50 a.m. The Roseburg City Council will consider improvements at the airport, parking enforcement and other topics at its meeting Monday night. The council will vote on authorizing acceptance of a grant offer from the Federal Aviation Administration in the maximum amount of $500,000 to be used towards the airport fencing and...

entry.title: YMCA OF DOUGLAS COUNTY CLOSED THROUGH LABOR DAY, SEPTEMBER 1ST
entry.summary: August 25, 2025 3:20 a.m. The YMCA of Douglas County has closed its facility through Monday, September 1st. This closure is an annual event to take care of yearly maintenance and do some exciting upgrades. YMCA of Douglas County CEO Steven Stanfield said, “This project represents an important investment in our members and community”. Stanfield...

entry.title: ADAPT EARNS THRIVE UMPQUA WORKSITE CERTIFICATION
entry.summary: August 25, 2025 2:50 a.m. Adapt Integrated Health Care has officially been designated as a Certified Worksite by Thrive Umpqua, a recognition of its ongoing commitment to employee health and well-being. A Thrive Umpqua release said the recertification acknowledges Adapts’ dedication to fostering a healthier work environment, building upon initiatives that began with the Blue...

entry.title: Twisted Steel RC Hobby Shop Announces Store Closing
entry.summary: Twisted Steel RC Hobby Shop in Roseburg is closing its doors. The store confirmed it is going out of business, urging customers to use credits and warranties soon. A cash-only blowout sale with up to 50% off starts August 22, 2025. All sales final, no refunds or exchanges.

entry.title: Claire’s in Roseburg to Close on August 26
entry.summary: Claire’s in Roseburg, located at 780 NW Garden Valley Boulevard, Suite 100, will close on August 26, 2025. The closure is part of the retailer’s nationwide bankruptcy restructuring. Shoppers can expect liquidation sales until the final day, marking the end of a nostalgic local favorite.

entry.title: RESIDENTIAL STRUCTURE SUSTAINS STRUCTURAL, SMOKE AND WATER DAMAGE
entry.summary: August 25, 2025 3:40 p.m. A residential structure in west Roseburg sustained significant structural, smoke and water damage in a fire early Sunday morning. Fire Chief Tyler Christopherson from the Roseburg Fire Department said at 6:15 a.m. firefighters responded to the fire in the 500 block of West Harrison Street, with smoke showing from outside...

entry.title: ROSEBURG SETS RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURE FOR THE DATE ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: August 24, 2025 5:50 a.m. Roseburg set a new record high temperature for the date on Saturday. Data from the National Weather Service in Medford said the mercury reached 102 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record high for August 23rd was 99 degrees, set in 1934. entry.title: Q&A with Sen. Ron Wyden
entry.summary: Oregon Senator Ron Wyden joined News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN News Director Kyle Bailey in the studio Monday, answering questions and asking for opinions of events happening in Washington D.C. which affect Douglas County.
